ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Who was the main person taking care of you when you were growing up (before age 18)? Was it a mother, father, grandparent, older brother or sister, another relative, or a foster or adoptive parent?
Notes: 1 = Mother and father; 2 = Mother or father plus step-parent; 3 = Mother; 4 = Father; 5 = Grandparent; 6 = Older brother or sister; 7 = Other relative; 8 = Foster parent; 9 = Adoptive parent

ElementDescription: Was it always the same person?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes. If Yes, skip to e

ElementDescription: Was it the same person through age 13?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes. If Yes, skip to d

ElementDescription: Was it the same person through age 5?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: How many different people had the main responsibility for taking care of you, up to age 18?
Did either of your parents die before you were age 6?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: How many times did you move by age 13?
Notes: 9 = 9 or more. Moving between foster homes counts as a move

ElementDescription: Did you ever witness or experience a violent crime, like a shooting or a rape, by age 13?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes. If No, skip to K4

ElementDescription: Did this happen more than once by age 13?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Were you ever a victim?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = Refused

ElementDescription: By the time you were age 13, were you ever sexually abused?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: By the time you were age 13, were you ever beaten by an adult so badly that you needed medical care or had marks on your body that lasted for more than 30 days?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = Refused

ElementDescription: Now I'm going to ask about use of drugs or alcohol in the household where you grew up, by the time you were 13 years old. Were you ever aware of adults in your household drinking enough to get drunk, or using drugs or alcohol, by the time you were 13?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes. If No, skip to K10

ElementDescription: Were you aware of the adults in your household, or your older siblings, drinking enough to get drunk by the time you were 13?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes. If No, skip to K6

ElementDescription: Did this happen more than ten times?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: What was the earliest age when you had access to alcohol yourself?
Notes: Code age or "0" for never had access

ElementDescription: Were you aware of the adults in your household, or your older siblings, using cocaine by the time you were 13?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes. If No, skip to K7

ElementDescription: Did this happen more than ten times?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: What was the earliest age when you had access to cocaine yourself?
Notes: Code age or "0" for never had access

ElementDescription: Were you aware of the adults in your household, or your older siblings, using heroin by the time you were 13?
Notes: 0 = No (if No, skip to K8); 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Did this happen more than ten times?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: What was the earliest age when you had access to heroin yourself?
Notes: Code age or "0" for never had access

ElementDescription: Were you aware of the adults in your household, or your older siblings, using other illegal drugs by the time you were 13?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Were you aware of the adults in your household, or your older siblings, using prescription drugs by the time you were 13?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Were any of the adults in your household regular cigarette smokers by the time you were 13?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: How often did you attend religious services as a child, up to and including age 13?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Several times yearly; 3 = Monthly; 5 = Weekly or almost weekly

ElementDescription: Were you ever in full-time day care (other than with a relative) prior to kindergarten?
Notes: 0 = No (If No, skip to K13); 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: How many years were you in full-time day care?
How would you describe the quality of your relationship with your main caregiver up to age 13?
Notes: 1 = Excellent; 2 = Very good; 3 = Good; 4 = Fair; 5 = Poor

ElementDescription: Was the person you were closest to usually available to you when you needed him or her?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Do you feel you could confide in this person when necessary?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Was this person aware of who your friends were?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Sometimes; 2 = Yes

ElementDescription: How often did you see or have contact with your grandparents or other relatives when you were younger (before age 13)? (Do not include a relative who was also the primary caregiver.)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Weekly (or more) to more than monthly; 3 = Monthly to more than yearly; 4 = Yearly or less frequently

ElementDescription: What was your favorite cartoon character - from television, movies, comics, or even advertisements - when you were growing up?
